result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Lester Tompkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard Lester Tompkins is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Richard Lester Tompkins was found guilty of Impersonating a Peace Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.70(1)(a).
  • Richard Lester Tompkins was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: concurrent to count 3 and any other sentence, with credit for 1 (one) day time served.

miscConds.notes: EACH COUNT:  Pay all mandatory costs, disbursement and surcharges by December 7, 2016, cash bail to apply. Any remaining balance will be due immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.
Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
No new law violations arising to level of probable cause.

Follow all rules of probation agent.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: (STRAIGHT TIME) This time is stayed to be used at the agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Richard Lester Tompkins in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:  

Defendant sentenced to serve 7 months in the House of Correction, concurrent to count 3 and any other sentence, with credit for 1 (one) day time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 months:


CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   As a condition of probation, the Court ordered
          the defendant to serve 2-10 days sanction (STRAIGHT TIME)
          in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed 
          to be used at the agent's discretion. 
     *   Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed
          medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.          
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
     *   No new law violations arising to level of probable cause.
     *   Follw all rules of probation agent.
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs, disbursement and surcharges 
          by December 7, 2016, cash bail to apply. 
          Any remaining balance will be due immediately or an 
          entry of a civil judgment.
   
AS TO COUNT 3:

Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to count 1 and any other sentence, with credit for 1 (one) day time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 months:


CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   As a condition of probation, the Court ordered
          the defendant to serve 2-10 days sanction (STRAIGHT TIME)
          in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed 
          to be used at the agent's discretion. 
     *   Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed
          medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.          
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
     *   No new law violations arising to level of probable cause.
     *   Follw all rules of probation agent.
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs, disbursement and surcharges 
          by December 7, 2016, cash bail to apply. 
          Any remaining balance will be due immediately or an 
          entry of a civil judgment.

-20 day appeal given,

Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights; received and filed.

Defendant Richard Lester Tompkins in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.  Case calendared for sentencing hearing.
Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 37.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Richard Lester Tompkins in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
As to Counts 1 and 3:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
As to Count 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Count 2 dismissed.

Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 37.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Richard Lester Tompkins in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for pre-trial conference.   Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mark E. Kershek contacted the Court to reschedule June 5, 2015 at 8:30 a.m. pre-trial conference.   Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 37 on July 7, 2015 at 1:30 p.m. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Richard Lester Tompkins in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered stayed arrest warrant lifted.
  OCCR Tape #15-102
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Remaining bail to be returned to the remitter.
Court orders no use or posession of any patches or badges that may resemble a police officer's badge or credentials.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Richard Lester Tompkins in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered stayed arrest warrant lifted.
  OCCR Tape #15-102
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mark E. Kershek in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, court ordered arrest warrant issued but STAYED issuance until the next court date.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
